1.expected_text:
From: john.smith@construction.com
To: jane.doe@client.com
Date: Wed, 25 Jun 2025 15:58:32 
Subject: RE: Project Status Update

Hi Jane,

Thank you for your email regarding the project status. I wanted to provide you with an update on our progress.

We have completed the foundation work and are currently working on the structural framing. The project remains on schedule, and we expect to complete this phase by the end of next week.

Please find attached the latest progress photos and updated schedule.

Best regards,
John Smith
Project Manager

Page 1 of 3

6.expected_text:
SMITH & ASSOCIATES ENGINEERING
June 25, 2025
Ms. Sarah Johnson
Project Director
City Planning Department
100 Civic Center Dr
Downtown, ST 11111
Dear Ms. Johnson:
Following our conversation yesterday, I am writing to formally submit our permit application for the Downtown Office Complex project.

The application package includes all required documentation, including:
- Completed permit application forms
- Architectural drawings and specifications
- Structural engineering calculations
- Environmental impact assessment
- Traffic study results

We have addressed all comments from the preliminary review and believe the application is now complete. Please let me know if you require any additional information.

We look forward to your review and approval of this application.

Page 1 of 2
Respectfully submitted,
Robert Smith, P.E.

8.expected_text:
REQUEST FOR INFORMATION (RFI)
RFI Number: RFI-2024-008
Date: 06/25/2025
Project: Downtown Office Complex - Phase 2
To: Architectural Team
From: General Contractor - BuildCo Inc.
Response Required By: 07/02/2025
Description:
The specifications call for "premium grade exterior cladding" on the north facade, but the material schedule lists standard grade aluminum panels. 

Please clarify which material should be used and provide updated specifications if necessary.

This RFI is critical for maintaining the project schedule as the cladding installation is scheduled to begin next month.

Page 1 of 2

20.expected_text:
TECHNICAL SPECIFICATION

Project: Downtown Office Complex
Document: Structural Requirements
Revision: 2.1
Date: June 25, 2025

1. SCOPE OF WORK
This specification covers the structural requirements for the Downtown Office Complex project.

2. MATERIALS
All structural steel shall conform to ASTM A992 standards.
Concrete shall have a minimum compressive strength of 4000 psi.

3. DESIGN LOADS
Live Load: 50 psf (offices), 100 psf (corridors)
Dead Load: As calculated
Wind Load: Per local building code

Page 1 of 2
